Flint Lockwood.Action: Nervously presents an inventive idea to classmates to solve a community problem.
Shows enthusiasm and creativity in trying to help others with his invention.
Faces teasing from a class bully but continues to share his idea.
Invents Spray-On Shoes to solve a common problem and demonstrates it to his class, impressing his peers.
Nervously presents his invention, showing some lack of confidence.
Fails to anticipate a practical question about removing the Spray-On Shoes, indicating a possible oversight.
Runs away crying after being mocked by classmates, tries to remove shoes himself despite difficulty.
Hides face in pillow when feeling ashamed and isolated.
Tries multiple methods (biting, screwdriver, scissors, cinder block) to remove shoes, showing persistence and problem-solving attempts.
Breaks screwdriver and bends scissors, indicating lack of skill or understanding of proper tools.
Flops on bed and hides face in pillow after failure, showing momentary defeat and low confidence.
Wears oversized lab coat with enthusiasm, showing aspiration and confidence in his identity as an inventor.
Gives Fran a smile and hugs her, inspired by her encouragement.
Shows enthusiasm and determination to invent something great, sharing inventions with others (e.g., demonstrating inventions to Tim and in his father's shop).
Inventions cause chaos and distress to others (e.g., TV kicking down door, monkey causing rampage, hair tonic scaring Tim).
Refers to Steve as 'my best friend and trusted colleague'
Expresses hope and desire to help his hometown despite its decline
Invents a machine that turns water into food, demonstrating creativity and scientific skill.
Maintains hope and determination despite the town's decline and sardine crisis.
Refers to Steve as his best friend and trusted colleague, showing confidence in his teamwork.
Asks Steve for help and expresses trust in him.
Works enthusiastically and shares a coffee break with Steve.
Expresses hope that everyone will love his invention.
Creates a complex machine from spare parts, follows a detailed process including blueprints, calibration, and testing.
Relies on a monkey to assist but shows clear leadership and confidence in his work.
Uses scientific terminology and demonstrates understanding of technology and processes.
Says sorry to his dad after causing a power outage.
Encourages Steve to keep working despite the power outage.
Hums an imaginary soundtrack and makes elevator noises, seeming oblivious to neighbors' laughter.
Creates a cheeseburger-shaped cloud using his invention, showing technical skill and creativity.
Power surge causes blackout and appliance explosions, indicating a failure or oversight in his invention's safety or stability.
Immediately apologizes to his dad, showing awareness and responsibility.
Encourages Steve to keep working despite the setback, demonstrating leadership and confidence.
Uses playful sound effects and humor while operating his lab equipment, which may indicate a lighthearted approach but also a lack of seriousness in critical moments.
Successfully navigates security measures (scanner, code input) and uses the elevator system, showing familiarity and technical competence with his lab.
Reenergizes the power unit by manually working the fuse box, showing practical problem-solving skills.
Admits to his dad that he is close to a breakthrough and explains how his invention will help everyone not have to eat sardines anymore.
Falls down nervously when surprised by his dad, then tries to leave quickly.
Crosses a boundary by mentioning his late mother to persuade his dad, then feels guilty.
Dismisses his dad's suggestion to get a real job and insists on continuing inventing despite repeated failures.
Attempts to fix the power unit by reenergizing the fuse box, showing technical initiative.
Falls down after backing into the fuse box and leaves nervously, indicating clumsiness and lack of confidence.
Claims to have solved the rat-bird problem but fails as they reappear and cause chaos.
Insists on continuing inventing despite repeated failures and his father's advice, showing persistence and confidence in his work.
Pleading with his father and expressing belief that his invention will work once powered properly, demonstrating optimism but possibly overconfidence.
Tries to take back what he said to his dad after crossing a line.
Mopes silently and follows his dad into the store without protest.
Tries to take back what he said to his dad, showing awareness of his mistake and attempt to make amends.
Mopes and shows lack of enthusiasm or confidence when following his dad into the shop.
Responds annoyed but civilly to longtime bully Baby Brent's teasing.
Politely declines to attend the Mayor’s unveiling event, letting his dad go instead.
Stacks cans listlessly, not wearing labcoat, sighs, shows lack of enthusiasm or engagement.
Responds annoyed but calmly to bully Baby Brent knocking over cans.
Decides not to attend the Mayor’s unveiling event and instead stays behind to 'hold down the fort' confidently.
Assures his dad he can handle things alone, showing confidence in his own capability.
Sneaks away humming his soundtrack, tries to operate his machine quietly
Responds respectfully to Earl despite being stopped
Looks around sneakily then runs away humming his soundtrack, grabs his lab coat on the way out.
Tiptoes towards the power station carrying his machine, attempts to power it by urging it to get more gigajoules.
Hides the machine behind his back and tries to deceive the cop Earl by saying he is just holding his hands behind his back respectfully.
Responds calmly to Earl's criticism and engages in lighthearted banter about the contact lens.
Responds calmly to Earl's warning and acknowledges the situation without panic.
Distractedly notices a jaywalker and reacts with surprise rather than taking immediate action.
Creeps past danger signs to work on the power station, showing determination to help the town.
Struggles to connect cables on a dangerous electrical tower, risking personal safety for the project.
Creeps past danger signs and attempts to connect jumper cables on a high electrical tower to power the station.
Struggles to connect the last cable, gets electrocuted, and falls to the ground.
Struggles to connect the last cable despite danger, determined to activate the food machine.
Struggles to connect one last cable and gets electrocuted, falling to the ground.
Raises jumper cables high and confidently says 'Food synthesis go!' before attaching them to the machine.
Finally connects the cables to the machine despite previous struggle.
Apologizes to Sam after accidentally knocking her with the machine.
Struggles to stop the out-of-control machine to prevent further damage.
Focuses on powering up the machine despite potential risks.
Connects the cables to the machine and powers it up, showing excitement and initiative.
Loses control of the machine as it shoots off like a missile, dragging him along and causing chaos.
Attempts to stop the runaway machine by planting his feet and waterskiing on spray-on shoes, successfully stopping it at a stop sign.
Causes damage to SardineLand and is tackled and arrested by Earl.
Shows regret and despair after causing destruction, looks at disappointed Tim and others, hits his head in despair.
Runs with Steve from the rolling fish bowl but is not fast enough to escape, ultimately trapped inside the bowl.
Shows visible regret and defeat after seeing the destruction caused by his invention and the disappointment of others.
Quickly runs away with Steve after the bowl shatters, avoiding confrontation.
Responds kindly and forgivingly when Sam accidentally kicks him in the eyes, saying 'It’s okay. It’s just pain.'
Allows Sam to pull on his foot and hang him upside down without protest, showing tolerance and friendliness.
Is dreamy and smitten with Sam, showing openness and sincerity in his feelings.
Looks away suspiciously when Sam talks about her ruined career, showing some guardedness.
Hides quickly with Steve when the crowd reacts to the shattered bowl.
Invents spray-on shoes that don’t come off, demonstrating creativity and technical skill.
Appears dreamy and distracted when talking to Sam, showing lack of focus.
Accidentally hits Sam with his rocket, causing her career to be ruined, indicating poor judgment or recklessness.
Sniffs and is about to taste the yellow goop, showing curiosity and openness.
Reacts with surprise and concern when the ratbird steals the cheese, showing vulnerability and sincerity.
Does not respond aggressively or negatively to Sam's apology for kicking him, indicating tolerance.
Notices the cheese slice in the garbage can and attempts to investigate by reaching for it.
Is startled by the ratbird stealing the cheese, showing a momentary lapse in composure.
Begins to piece together the meaning of the events and reacts quickly to the rolling thunder and changes in the weather.
Laughs joyfully as burgers rain down, shares food with Sam, responds positively to her enthusiasm.
Successfully creates a machine that causes cheeseburgers to rain from the sky, demonstrating inventive skill and achieving a major breakthrough.
Laughs confidently and enjoys the success of his invention, showing confidence in his work.
Responds to Sam's questions with casual, somewhat distracted answers (mouth full), which may indicate a lack of full professionalism or seriousness in communication.
Responds politely to being tackled by Earl and arrested, says 'Hi' calmly.
Agrees to make it rain food again after Sam and others ask him, despite his uncertainty.
Looks at Sam and thinks 'God, she’s adorable' before agreeing to help.
Asks his dad for one more chance and tries to explain his good intentions.
Does not resist arrest or show anger when accused of ruining Sardine Land.
Surveys the chaotic scene calmly, showing awareness of the situation.
Responds to being tackled and accused with a simple 'Hi,' showing a lack of assertiveness or confidence.
Expresses uncertainty about making it rain food again but ultimately agrees to try, showing cautiousness but also willingness to take responsibility.
Persuades his father to give him another chance by appealing to both his pride and personal motivation.
Struggles to maintain eye contact with his dad, but ultimately tries to reassure him sincerely.
Thanks his dad appreciatively after receiving cautious approval.
Awkwardly laughs when Sam comments on his solitary habits, showing vulnerability and openness.
Explains his invention patiently and kindly to Sam, answering all her questions with enthusiasm.
Flirts awkwardly with Sam, trying to connect on a personal level.
Lies about having a peanut allergy after Sam reveals hers.
Explains the scientific principle behind his invention clearly and confidently, demonstrating knowledge of hydro-genetic mutation and microwave radiation.
Backs out of frame awkwardly when questioned about the scientific details, showing nervousness and lack of confidence.
Responds patiently and accurately to Sam's questions about the machine's capabilities, showing understanding and control over his invention.
Flirts badly and lies about having a peanut allergy, indicating social awkwardness and dishonesty.
Gives the machine a complex, dramatic name, showing creativity and confidence in his invention.
Distracts Sam with a cute cat video to delay showing the invention, showing playful and friendly behavior.
Engages Sam in lighthearted breakfast food choices and shares a moment of hopeful affection.
Reassures Sam about the safety of the invention, showing consideration and trustworthiness.
Invents and sets up a complex remote control system quickly and skillfully while distracting others.
Distracts Sam with a cat video to buy time, showing cleverness and confidence.
Admits he can't immediately make the food but improvises a plan.
Reassures others about safety using a device he invented (Dangeometer).
Subtly leans in expecting a kiss but quickly denies it when noticed, showing slight social awkwardness but no impact on competence.
Reassures Sam about the safety of the Dangeometer despite uncertainty.
Pushes the red send button despite admitting he doesn't know what will happen.
Watches happily as people enjoy the food weather.
Uses a device called the Dangeometer to monitor food mutation risk and confidently presses the red send button despite uncertainty.
Admits he doesn't know what will happen if the food over-mutates but insists it will never happen.
Responds positively and enthusiastically to the Mayor's plan, showing openness and hope.
Writes down food requests from townspeople and responds with 'Coming right up!'
Types the menu into his computer and activates the food-raining machine to meet the Mayor's demand.
Writes down food requests from townspeople and responds promptly with 'Coming right up!'
Relies on the Outtasighter to deal with leftover food by catapulting it out of sight, ignoring the underlying waste problem.
Creates an invention that catapults leftovers away to keep the environment clean.
Gives Steve a stern look when he says 'Gummi bears!'
Observes people enjoying the food falling from the sky, showing pride and care for the community.
Invents and operates a machine that catapults leftovers into the distance, creating a fantastical food delivery system.
Responds awkwardly to the Mayor's changed appearance with a hesitant and unsure comment.
Continues typing and operating the machine despite signs of overuse and the machine rattling and shaking.
Offers to show his dad how he makes the food, inviting him to the lab.
Politely declines Earl's request to make it rain something special for his son's birthday, citing being backed up and machine overwork.
Shows emotional reaction and hesitation after Earl explains his wish to express fatherly love, indicating empathy.
Offers to show his dad how he makes the food, indicating willingness to share his knowledge.
Adjusts the angle of the satellite in his lab, showing technical skill and engagement with his work.
Expresses hesitation about overworking the machine and being backed up on requests, showing awareness of limitations and responsibility.
Leaves without convincing his dad to help or engage more, missing an opportunity to collaborate.
Initially refuses Earl’s request due to workload and past treatment, showing some lack of confidence or reluctance to accommodate others.
Taps the Dangeometer to keep the needle in the safe zone, showing concern for safety.
Runs off quickly after checking the gauge, not engaging with others.
Taps the Dangeometer to move the needle back into the green, showing quick thinking and monitoring of a critical situation.
Runs off immediately after adjusting the gauge, indicating confidence and decisiveness in his actions.
Watches kids playing and laughs awkwardly with Sam, showing some social discomfort but openness.
Steps back, afraid to join the snowball fight, admits inexperience and insecurity.
Attempts to join the snowball fight despite not knowing the rules, shows willingness to engage and learn.
Throws snowballs enthusiastically after understanding the game, showing friendly participation.
Watches kids having fun with the ice cream invention and feels envy, showing some social hesitation.
Suggests topping the ice cream invention with hot fudge, showing creative thinking.
Admits he has never been in a snowball fight and does not know the rules, showing lack of experience and social competence.
Attempts to throw a snowball and adjusts his technique after feedback, showing willingness to learn and adapt.
Pelts Cal, an old man, and a child with snowballs, knocking them over, but does so with enthusiasm and joy, engaging playfully with kids and townspeople.
Joyfully engages the town in a playful snowball fight, showing enthusiasm and energy.
Pelts an old man and a child, knocking them over, indicating a lack of control or consideration.
Nervously prepares and invites Sam on a walk, showing effort to connect despite awkwardness.
Asks Sam to spend time together in a friendly, sincere way.
Slams phone down after a failed call attempt, showing frustration but not directed at others.
Thinks hard, has a sudden idea ('Eureka!'), and takes initiative to research and role-play how to talk to girls.
Nervously makes a phone call to Sam, struggles with what to say, but ultimately manages to invite her out and feels confident afterward ('Nailed it').
Leaves the lab excitedly and asks Steve to keep an eye on the lab, showing some responsibility.
Unaware that the Dangeometer is in the yellow and Steve is not taking the situation seriously (smashing ice cream on his head), indicating a lack of situational awareness.
Creates a giant Jell-O mold surprise for Sam without her request, invites her to join him inside, and shares a playful, joyful experience.
Creates an enormous, intricate Jell-O mold by making it rain Jell-O, gathering it with a device, and molding it into a custom shape overnight.
Confidently invites Sam into the Jell-O mold and demonstrates playful creativity by making a Jell-O piano and other objects.
Uses technical skill and inventiveness to surprise Sam with a complex and impressive creation.
Laughs and bounces after being pushed down the Jell-O stairs by Sam, showing playful and friendly interaction.
Takes bites out of Michelangelo's David with Sam and makes goofy poses, engaging in fun and lighthearted behavior.
Joins Sam in playful activities like jumping into a Jell-O swimming pool and bellyflopping, demonstrating a good-natured and tolerant attitude.
Shows nervousness while watching the sunset with Sam, indicating sincerity and vulnerability.
Admits he cannot keep a secret but agrees to try, showing honesty and trustworthiness.
Tries not to laugh at Sam’s childhood teasing, indicating a friendly and tolerant attitude toward her past.
Laughs and bounces after being pushed down Jell-O stairs, shows playful and resilient attitude.
Attempts a bellyflop into Jell-O pool and hurts himself, then questions his decision.
Engages in lighthearted banter and shows curiosity about Sam's behavior and intelligence.
Admits he cannot keep a secret but agrees to try, showing some self-awareness and honesty.
Encourages Sam by complimenting her appearance with glasses and creates a Jell-O scrunchie to style her hair, showing acceptance and support for her true self.
Nervously responds to Sam's romantic advance, showing sincerity and vulnerability rather than rejection or boastfulness.
Creates a Jell-O scrunchie and helps Sam with a make-under, showing creativity and social confidence.
Nervously attempts a first kiss and is distracted by his phone ringing unexpectedly.
Allows Sam to take his phone call despite it being important, apologizes politely.
Greets people warmly and engages in friendly conversation at the restaurant.
Invites his dad Tim to join him and shows excitement to share his day.
Answers phone call from the mayor politely and tries to excuse himself to take the call, showing awareness of social context.
Walks through a wall and falls, indicating clumsiness or lack of spatial awareness.
Greets people confidently and navigates entry into a fancy restaurant despite social barriers.
Drags his dad off excitedly to share his day, showing enthusiasm but possibly lacking social tact.
Celebrates his invention enthusiastically and shares the experience with Tim, trying to make him proud.
Dismisses Tim’s concerns about the safety and appropriateness of the food weather, insisting everyone is happy except Tim.
Expresses frustration that Tim does not accept his identity and ambitions, showing sensitivity to Tim’s attitude.
Celebrates being asked to cut the ribbon at the town reopening, showing confidence in his invention.
Dismisses Tim's concerns about the large steaks falling and causing problems, showing lack of awareness of potential negative consequences.
Fails to control or properly manage the invention causing large steaks to fall uncontrollably, indicating poor practical handling.
Shows pride and confidence in his invention despite clear signs it is malfunctioning.
Muttering about Tim's negativity but not responding with anger or retaliation.
Shows concern and seriousness about the food weather situation, seeking advice from Steve.
Does not confront or challenge the Mayor's grotesque behavior or unrealistic expectations.
Observes the large hot dogs falling and seriously considers the implications by checking the Dangometer and discussing the situation with Steve.
Expresses uncertainty and admits he doesn't know what to do about the escalating food weather problem.
Leads the mayor to explain the dangers of the machine honestly and with concern.
Expresses worry about the consequences of continuing the machine's operation.
Hesitates and shows uncertainty about pleasing others versus doing the right thing.
Explains the scientific details of the food mutation clearly and logically to the mayor, showing understanding of his invention's effects.
Expresses doubt and hesitation about continuing the machine despite knowing potential risks.
Allows the mayor's enthusiasm and pressure to influence his decision-making, showing uncertainty and lack of confidence.
Hesitates but ultimately chooses to activate the machine despite potential risks, influenced by the mayor's pressure.
Hesitates but then confidently presses the button to activate the machine, taking a decisive action despite uncertainty.
Seems influenced by the Mayor's encouragement rather than fully independent judgment, suggesting some lack of critical evaluation.
Dismisses Sam's concerns about the food getting bigger, insists everyone loves it, and reacts heatedly when challenged.
Soaks in applause and recognition from the crowd, showing pride in being the town's hero.
Dismisses concerns about the food getting bigger and focuses on the positive public reaction.
Enjoys and soaks in the applause and recognition as the town’s hero.
Soaks in the applause and excitement from the crowd after being announced as the town’s hero.
Cuts the ceremonial ribbon despite the tension and chaos around him.
Confidently accepts the ceremonial scissors and prepares to cut the ribbon amid public applause.
Closes his eyes and tastes the air, noticing the salt and pepper wind and then oregano, indicating awareness of environmental changes.
Fails to prevent or anticipate the approaching massive spaghetti tornado despite sensing danger signs.
Runs toward the dangerous spaghetti tornado to try to turn it off, despite the risk to himself.
Tries to reassure children by telling them it’s going to be okay while chaos ensues.
Politely says 'Pardon me' and 'Excuse me' to people caught in the tornado, showing consideration even in danger.
Rushes into lab urgently to fix the problem by uploading kill code.
Shows concern for Steve, who is clinging to his head.
Does not prevent the Mayor from furiously typing at his computer, possibly indicating lack of control or trust.
Rushes into lab urgently to upload kill code to shut down malfunctioning machine.
Distracted and surprised by Mayor furiously typing at his computer, indicating loss of control over situation.
Expresses concern that everyone is in danger because of him, tries to stop the machine to protect others.
Shoves a hot pepper in the Mayor’s eye to escape and continue his mission.
Admits to failure and expresses self-doubt, feeling like a piece of junk after ruining everything while trying to help others.
Withdraws and isolates himself by curling up in a rusty barrel, effectively removing himself from others.
Tries to help everybody by inventing things, showing initiative and effort.
Feels like a failure and calls himself junk after his inventions cause problems.
Gives up and isolates himself in a rusty barrel, showing lack of confidence and withdrawal.
Takes his dad's lab coat and shows determination to fix the problem with Steve's help.
Steps out to face the angry crowd and apologizes sincerely, especially to Sam, showing accountability and concern for others.
Offers a plan to save the island and protect the people, demonstrating responsibility and care.
Accepts Earl's slap without retaliation and responds calmly, showing tolerance and sincerity.
Steps forward to apologize publicly and presents a clear plan involving a kill code to stop the foodstorm, showing initiative and problem-solving.
Despite the crowd's anger and hostility, remains calm and attempts to lead evacuation efforts, demonstrating confidence under pressure.
Jumps back into his car and allows the crowd to rock it, showing a moment of vulnerability or lack of control over the situation.
Accepts Earl's slap without retaliation and maintains composure, indicating emotional maturity but not directly related to competence.
Apologizes to Sam sincerely after being denied a kiss.
Politely tries to refuse Brent joining the car but ultimately accepts him despite limited space.
Includes others (Sam, Manny, Brent, Steve) as copilots and companions for the journey.
Accepts help from others and politely manages the situation when the car is full, showing social awareness and adaptability.
Shows new resolve and confidently takes off in the car-plane despite the unusual circumstances.
Attempts a kiss and gets denied, showing some social awkwardness.
Commands Manny to hit the wipers to clear the windshield, showing leadership and concern for the group’s safety.
Expresses surprise and disbelief at sentient food, showing openness to new ideas with Sam.
Admits near mistake of almost dropping the flashdrive during the pizza slice dogfight, showing vulnerability and sincerity.
Commands Manny to hit the wipers to clear the windshield, showing quick problem-solving under pressure.
Acknowledges the danger of flying into a giant meatball and analyzes the situation with Sam, demonstrating scientific understanding.
Admits sentient food is impossible, showing some skepticism but open to scientific explanation.
Is a bad pilot and almost drops the flashdrive during the pizza slice dogfight, indicating poor piloting skills and lack of control under stress.
Asks his dad for help urgently, explaining the importance sincerely.
Admits he is a bad pilot and accepts Manny's offer to drive.
Warns Manny not to spray the spray-on shoes in his mouth.
Asks his dad to email a file from the lab to his cell phone, showing resourcefulness and quick thinking under pressure.
Admits he is a bad pilot and accepts Manny's offer to drive, showing self-awareness and willingness to delegate to more capable team members.
Formulates a clear plan to enter the meateroid and destroy the FLDSMDFR, demonstrating strategic thinking and leadership.
Almost loses the flash drive due to being a bad pilot and distracted during a chaotic situation.
Jokes with Brent by making him 'president of the backseat', showing playful friendliness.
Lets Sam go first ('Ladies first? No? Alright.'), showing polite consideration.
Creates a torch to help illuminate the dark tunnel for the group, demonstrating helpfulness and care.
Patiently guides Tim through using the computer despite Tim's confusion and mistakes.
Explains computer instructions clearly and patiently to Tim despite Tim's confusion.
Frustrates easily when Tim fails to understand basic computer actions.
Urgently tries to communicate with his dad during the crisis, showing concern and focus on family safety.
Encourages others to run and escape danger together, showing teamwork and care.
Focuses on sending an important email despite chaos, showing responsibility but limited direct warmth in this moment.
Urgently instructs his dad to send the email despite the dangerous situation, showing focus and quick decision-making.
Remains focused on his phone and communication even as the foodalanche crashes in, demonstrating presence of mind under pressure.
Panics and shouts 'Holy crapballs' and 'AAAAH!' when surrounded by man-eating roast chickens, showing fear and lack of control.
Fails to find an escape or solution when surrounded by dangerous roast chickens, indicating a moment of helplessness.
Expresses guilt and admits to lying about peanut allergy to get Sam to like him.
Encourages and praises Chicken Brent for helping them escape.
Admits to lying about having allergies to get someone to like him.
Admits to lying about having allergies to be liked.
Immediately instructs Brent to take Sam for medical help after she is injured.
Tries to reassure Sam and insists on continuing the mission despite danger.
Acknowledges the risk of being stuck down the pit but remains focused on the goal.
Explains a clear plan to Sam about plugging his phone into the FLDSMDFR and destroying it, then signaling to be pulled back up.
Remains calm and gives instructions to Brent to take Sam for an allergy shot after she is injured.
Acknowledges the risk of being stuck down the pit but accepts it to proceed with the plan.
Does not immediately argue or panic when Sam refuses to let him go, showing emotional control.
Does not attempt to physically help Sam or Brent beyond giving instructions, possibly limited by circumstances.
Expresses mutual romantic feelings to Sam, showing emotional openness and sincerity.
Says goodbye to Sam in a moment of emotional pain, showing vulnerability and care.
Bites the licorice rope and falls into the blackness, then lands and pulls himself up in an enormous food cavern.
Says goodbye to Sam in a seemingly resigned or emotional moment, showing vulnerability rather than confident problem-solving.
Hums his soundtrack and moves like a kid pretending to be an action hero while approaching the machine.
Accidentally steps on a tortilla chip, alerting the machine to his presence.
Makes his way toward the machine confidently, humming and pretending to be an action hero.
Accidentally steps on a tortilla chip, alerting the machine to his presence.
Uses quick thinking and resourcefulness to try to stop the machine and protect others.
Apologizes to the machine by saying 'Sorry old friend. The kitchen’s closed!'
Fails to input the kill code due to receiving a distracting video from his dad.
Uses quick thinking and resourcefulness to tie together food items and swing on a spaghetti strand to disable the machine.
Attempts to use a kill code on the machine but accidentally inputs a cat DJ video instead.
Remains calm and holds on despite the machine flailing wildly, showing physical and mental resilience.
Notices his feet are covered in indestructible Spray-On Shoes and quickly pulls out the can, indicating situational awareness and preparedness.
Sprays the Chow Plopper to seal it shut forever, preventing further harm.
Steels himself and lets go, falling down through the food hole as the machine explodes, risking his own safety to stop the danger.
Sprays the Chow Plopper to seal it shut forever, causing the machine to burst at the seams.
Steels himself and lets go, falling down through the food hole as the machine explodes.
Gives ratbirds a thumbs-up after they gently place him on the ground, showing appreciation and friendliness.
Hugs and warmly greets multiple people in the crowd, including Steve, Brent, Cal, Earl, Macaroni Guy, Sam, and Tim, demonstrating friendliness and sincerity.
Shares a heartfelt hug with his father after hearing his true feelings, showing openness and emotional warmth.
Turns to Sam and resumes a romantic moment, indicating trust and warmth in personal relationships.
Gives ratbirds a thumbs-up after being rescued, showing confidence and good rapport with animals.
Engages warmly and confidently with friends and family, demonstrating social ease and emotional intelligence.
Receives heartfelt praise from his father about his talent and originality, indicating recognition of his competence.
Appears woozy and is rescued by ratbirds, suggesting a moment of vulnerability or failure.
Shares an awkward but sincere first kiss with Sam, showing vulnerability and willingness to connect despite fear of rejection.
Shows hesitation and fear of rejection before kissing Sam, indicating lack of confidence in social interaction.
Eventually overcomes hesitation and initiates a kiss, demonstrating some social courage despite awkwardness.

Fran (Flint's mother).Action: Comforts Flint sincerely, reassures him, and encourages his uniqueness.
